title: Maha civic polls: Shinde corrals his 29 corporators in hotel; no question of poaching, says Fadnavis

With aspirations to secure the mayor's role for the initial 2.5 years and crucial committee positions, the Sena argues for justice in representation.

title: 'Not going down without a fight‚Äô: Thousands march in Greenland amid Trump's takeover threat
content: Thousands of Greenlanders protested against US President Donald Trump's renewed pressure to acquire the Arctic island, asserting their right to self-rule. Demonstrations in Nuuk and other cities voiced strong opposition to being "for sale," with Greenland's prime minister joining the rallies. The protests intensified following Trump's announcement of tariffs on goods from countries opposing US control.

title: Mumbai cha mayor kon? Suspense grows as Shiv Sena eyes first 2.5 years in BMC
content: Mumbai's mayoral race remains uncertain despite the BJP-Shinde Sena alliance's clear majority. Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT) vows to fight for their mayor, accusing rivals of betrayal. Meanwhile, the ruling alliance assures a consensus candidate, with power-sharing talks underway, leaving the final decision pending.

title: Handshake drama explained: BCB breaks silence on Ind vs Ban U-19 World Cup incident
content: A controversy arose during the U-19 World Cup match between India and Bangladesh as captains failed to exchange a customary handshake at the toss. The Bangladesh Cricket Board clarified the incident was unintentional, stemming from a lapse in concentration, and emphasized their commitment to sportsmanship amid existing cricketing tensions.

title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi-NCR: AQI ‚Äòsevere‚Äô at 439; cold wave keeps visibility poor
content: Several areas across the city reported alarmingly high pollution levels, reflecting the widespread nature of the pollution crisis. Anand Vihar recorded an AQI of 489, Ashok Vihar 463, Bawana 467, Chandni Chowk 464, Dwarka Sector 8 469, ITO 448, Narela 412, Punjabi Bagh 476, RK Puram 467 and Wazirpur 478. All these locations fell under the 'severe' category, indicating extremely poor air quality and heightened health risks.

title: Google vs court ruling: Tech giant refuses to share data with OpenAI
content: Google has urged an appeals court to halt a ruling that mandates sharing its data with rivals like OpenAI. The tech giant argues this order risks exposing trade secrets before its monopoly challenge is heard.  Google contends users choose its search engine willingly, not due to forced defaults, and that the ruling overlooks intense market competition.

title: Proud home record at stake! India face New Zealand in series decider
content: India aims to maintain their strong home ODI record against New Zealand in the series decider. While Kohli and Rahul are in form, Kuldeep Yadav's struggles are a concern. New Zealand, with an inexperienced squad, seeks a historic ODI series win in India, led by Daryl Mitchell's impressive batting.

title: Delhi blast probe: ED flags 'terror-linked faculty' at Al-Falah; assets seized
content: In a shocking revelation, University Chancellor Javed Ahmad Siddiqui is under scrutiny for allegedly hiring Dr. Umar Nabi, associated with the Red Fort bombing, along with two others, at Al-Falah University, bypassing necessary police background checks.

title: The silent curriculum: What Indian colleges overlook, but employers expect from graduates
content: Indian higher education's employability gap stems from a 'silent curriculum' largely missing for most students. Industry exposure, applied learning, certifications, and alumni networks, crucial for job readiness, remain theoretical for many. This invisible curriculum, not on transcripts, dictates outcomes, leaving degrees signaling education but not guaranteed professional readiness.

title: 'If it was Kohli in Babar's place': Ex-Pak cricketer on Smith controversy in BBL
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali sparked debate after defending Steve Smith in the Babar Azam controversy during a Big Bash League match. After Smith refused a single and then smashed a record 32-run over, Babar was dismissed soon after. Basit blamed Babar and controversially said Smith would never deny Virat Kohli a run. Kamran Akmal disagreed, calling Smith‚Äôs act disrespectful.

title: Kevin O‚ÄôLeary‚Äôs warning for US on China: America lacks grid for AI surge; China adds 500 GW
content: Kevin O'Leary, a prominent Canadian investor, voices a concerning warning about the AI surge in America: it's on a collision course with an energy crisis. He points out that while China's energy infrastructure is evolving rapidly‚Äîwith an impressive addition of 500 gigawatts‚Äîthe U.S. has shockingly added 'zero.

title: Golden Hour: The daily time that can change your luck
content: Harness the power of the golden hour, the tranquil period just after sunrise and before sunset, for enhanced mental clarity and emotional openness. This naturally calming time, recognized in ancient Indian traditions, aligns your mind for manifestation.

title: Did Mike Tomlin have an affair with a Pennsylvania nurse?
content: Mike Tomlin, the Pittsburgh Steelers‚Äô former coach, sparked chaos when he stepped down from his role after 19 seasons. Many fans have remain confused about the exact reason behind Mike Tomlin‚Äôs move. Amid all the mess, there has been a new discussion about Mike Tomlin allegedly cheating on his wife, Kiya Tomlin, with a nurse from Pennsylvania.

title: Maha civic polls: Shinde fears BJP; 'God willing, we‚Äôll have our mayor,' says Uddhav
content: Uddhav Thackeray leveled accusations against DCM Eknath Shinde, suggesting that his apprehension towards the BJP was evident in his decision to move newly elected corporators to a hotel, aiming to thwart potential party switches.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: Steelers nation demands change after Tomlin's steelers exit
content: Steelers Nation has accepted Mike Tomlin's departure after nearly two decades, with a poll showing 64.79% of fans believing it was the right decision. While acknowledging his past success and Super Bowl title, fans expressed frustration with recent playoff disappointments and conservative play-calling. Tomlin is reportedly considering a move to television.

title: Stephen Curry pens 'keep shooting' for Klay Thompson's 3-point mark
content: Klay Thompson has officially become the NBA's fourth all-time leader in three-pointers, surpassing Damian Lillard with 2,805 made.  This remarkable achievement, despite past injuries, drew praise from former teammate Stephen Curry.  The duo, once a legendary backcourt, continues to share mutual respect and support even after Thompson's move to Dallas.

title: First time in 232 years! Pak cricket team pulls off lowest successful run defence
content: Pakistan TV created history in the Presidents Trophy by pulling off the lowest successful run defence in first-class cricket. Defending just 40 runs, PTV beat Sui Northern Gas by two runs, breaking a 232-year-old record. Left-arm spinner Ali Usman starred with 6 for 9 as Sui Northern collapsed to 37 in a stunning finish.

title: ‚ÄòNot afraid of crackers‚Äô: Rogue elephant leaves deadly trail in Jharkhand
content: A rogue elephant, distinguished by a single tusk, has caused widespread terror in West Singhbhum, killing 20 people since January 1. Efforts to tranquilize the animal were tragically interrupted when a forest guard, Sukhlal Behera, was fatally attacked. The elephant has since retreated into Odisha, with authorities now focused on preventing its return.

title: 'Dhurandhar' sees good growth; India gross total to hit Rs 1000 crore
content: Despite a slow start to its seventh week, 'Dhurandhar' is making waves at the box office, nearing Rs 1000 crore domestically. The film's impressive week 7 performance places it third for the week, showcasing its enduring appeal. With a global collection exceeding Rs 1278 crore, it's on track to challenge box office giants.

title: 10-min‚Äô branding gone, but delivery gig is still survival of the quickest
content: Despite a government directive to abandon 10-minute delivery promises, quick commerce platforms continue to pressure delivery personnel.  Sumit Singh, a delivery agent, climbed 17 floors to deliver an order, highlighting the relentless race against time for earnings.  The underlying business model and customer expectations remain unchanged, perpetuating a system where delivery workers face immense pressure.

title: Nathan MacKinnon net worth: Avalanche star's earnings, investments revealed
content: Colorado Avalanche star Nathan MacKinnon boasts a net worth of approximately $30 million, fueled by lucrative NHL contracts and significant endorsement deals. His career earnings are projected to exceed $147 million by 2031.  MacKinnon's impressive accolades include a Stanley Cup, Hart Memorial Trophy, and Ted Lindsay Award, solidifying his status as a top earner and elite player.

title: ‚ÄòTime to look for new leadership‚Äô: Trump calls for end of 'sick' Khamenei's regime
content: President Trump called for new leadership in Iran, urging an end to Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's 37-year rule. This statement followed widespread protests and deadly crackdowns, with Trump previously threatening intervention. Khamenei responded by accusing Trump of responsibility for violence, while Trump countered that Iran's leadership relies on repression and violence to govern.

title: 'They don't bring investments': Trump-ally flags US-Pak bonhomie; urges closer India ties
content: Senior US lawmakers emphasized India's central role in America's Indo-Pacific strategy, highlighting its importance for global stability and strong economic ties. They clarified that routine engagement with Pakistan does not signify a strategic shift, as India remains the primary focus for US investments and partnerships.

title: Chloe Kim breaks silence on shoulder injury as Garrett heads to Switzerland
content: Myles Garrett, the Cleveland Browns‚Äô star player, has turned heads with his newfound romance with his girlfriend, two time Olympian Chloe Kim. As Chloe Kim gears up for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Switzerland, she suffered a brutal shoulder injury as she trained in Switzerland last week. The injury has sparked panic among fans and now, Chloe Kim has finally shared an update on her injury.

title: Newlywed Woman's Body Left Outside Parents' Home, Dowry Charges Follow
content: A newly married woman died under mysterious circumstances in Bihar's Vaishali district, triggering serious allegations against her in-laws.

title: Dense Fog Blankets Delhi-NCR, Low Visibility At Airport Amid Cold Wave
content: Residents of Delhi woke up to alarming air quality levels on Sunday morning as a thick blanket of toxic smog and dense fog engulfed the national capital, pushing pollution levels into the 'severe' category.

title: Denmark Calls Trump's Greenland Tariff Threats A "Surprise"
content: US President Donald Trump's threat to impose tariffs on European nations that do not let him acquire Greenland "come as a surprise", Denmark's foreign minister

title: NASA Rolls Out Rocket For Artemis 2, 1st Crewed Moon Mission In Over 50 Years
content: NASA on Saturday rolled out its towering SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft as it began preparations for its first crewed mission to the Moon in more than 50 years.

title: Al-Qaeda Affiliate Leader Linked To December Attack In Syria Killed By US
content: US military forces on Friday killed an al-Qaeda affiliate leader linked to an Islamic State attack on Americans in Syria last month, US Central Command said in a statement on Saturday.

title: AK-47 Rifles, Pistols, Ammunition Found Near India-Pakistan Border
content: Punjab's Pathankot Police, in coordination with central intelligence agencies, have recovered a large cache of arms and ammunition from the border area of Narot Jaimal Singh, close to the India-Pakistan border.

title: BJP's 45% Vote Share In Civic Body Polls Shows Decisive Mandate: Devendra Fadnavis
content: Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said the BJP's 45 per cent vote share in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections reflected a decisive mandate, and its tally was higher than that of Shiv Sena (UBT) despite contesting fewer seats.

title: Bengaluru Metro Fare Hike On Cards? BJP, Congress Blame Game Begins
content: Even as the citizens of Bengaluru are staring at another possible Metro fare hike, the BJP and Congress have begun a blame game over the issue.

title: India Presses Iran For Early Consular Access To 16 Detained Indians
content: India will continue to press Iranian authorities to grant early consular access to the 16 Indian crew members of a commercial vessel that was detained last month, the Indian embassy in Tehran said on Saturday.

title: "Election Was Very Strange...": Uddhav Thackeray On Civic Body Polls
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) president Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday described the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections held on January 15 as a "strange" and desperate fight for his opponents.

title: Kidnapped By Mob And Gang-Raped 2 Years Ago, Kuki Woman Dies In Manipur
content: A woman from the Kuki tribe, who was gang-raped after she was kidnapped by a group of men from Manipur's capital Imphal just after the Meitei-Kuki ethnic clashes broke out in May 2023, has died of an illness aggravated by the trauma.

title: 'Time For New Leadership': Trump Calls For End To Khamenei's Rule In Iran
content: US President Donald Trump called for an end to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's 37-year-old rule

title: Search Underway For Indonesia Air Transport Plane With 10 On Board
content: Indonesian authorities are searching for a plane carrying three government workers and seven crew members after contact with the aircraft was lost on Saturday, officials said.

title: Afraid He Would 'Sacrifice' Them To Get Rich, 3 Men Kill Friend In Ghaziabad
content: In a bizarre murder in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad, three friends killed a man with a gas cylinder and then set his body ablaze because they were afraid he would 'sacrifice' one of them to get rich, as suggested by an occultist.

title: EU, Mercosur Sign Free Trade Pact After 25 Years Of Negotiations
content: Top officials from the EU and the South American bloc Mercosur signed a free trade agreement on Saturday in Paraguay, paving the way for the European Union's largest ever trade accord after 25 years of negotiations.

title: In Indore Court, A Snapped Pencil Proves Deadly Reality Of Banned Kite String
content: A courtroom fell silent when a simple yellow pencil snapped under the force of a thin kite string. At the Madhya Pradesh High Court, Indore Bench, the danger of Chinese kite string, popularly known as manjha, was not argued in words but demonstrated.

title: 'Not Coordinated': Netanyahu Says Trump's Gaza Board Against Israel's Policy
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Saturday that this week's Trump administration announcement on the composition of a Gaza executive board was not coordinated with Israel and ran counter to government policy.

title: Hindu Man Killed With Shovel While Trying To Save Employee In Bangladesh
content: A Hindu man was beaten to death in the Gazipur district of Bangladesh while trying to protect his shop employee from an assault, police said on Saturday.

title: Trump Imposes 10% Tariff On Denmark, UK, France For Opposing Greenland Plan
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday declared that he would charge a 10 per cent tariff on European countries because of their opposition to America's Greenland takeover.

title: 21-Year-Old Woman Mauled To Death By Leopard Near Sugarcane Field In UP
content: A 21-year-old woman was mauled to death by a leopard in the Nichlaul Range of the Sohgirwa Wildlife Sanctuary here on Saturday, officials said.

title: Francis Ngannou‚Äôs net worth boom from UFC champion to boxing mega‚Äëpurses
content: Francis Zavier Ngannou was born on September 5, 1986, in the town of Bati√© in Cameroon. Francis Ngannou began boxing training at the age of 22, but after a year, he had to stop because of illness. Francis Ngannou signed with the Ultimate Fighting Championship and made his UFC debut in December 2015 against another newcomer, Luis Henrique.

title: U19 WC: 8 wickets in eight overs! India snatch victory from Bangladesh's grasp
content: Vihaan Malhotra's brilliant 4/14 spell triggered a dramatic Bangladesh collapse, securing an 18-run DLS victory for India in a rain-hit Under 19 World Cup match. Despite a strong start in their chase, Bangladesh faltered against Malhotra's spin, falling short of the revised target. Earlier, Kundu and Sooryavanshi anchored India's innings.

title: Follow live: Seahawks in control over 49ers with NFC championship on the line
content: The NFL's divisional playoff round started with a bang Saturday when the  Denver Broncos  defeated the  Buffalo Bills   33-30 in overtime . In the second game, the  San Francisco 49ers  and  Seattle Seahawks  are facing off at Lumen Field in the third meeting between the NFC West rivals this season. Sunday's action starts with the  Houston Texans  playing at the  New England Patriots  ( 3 p.m. ET, ABC/ESPN ) and concludes with the  Los Angeles Rams  heading to frigid Chicago to play the  Chicago Bears  ( 6:30 p.m. ET, NBC/Peacock ).
